result.execSummary:
All charges against Troy Earl Smith Jr in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Troy Earl Smith Jr is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy Earl Smith Jr

Defendant Troy Earl Smith Jr in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Troy Earl Smith Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to DISMISS is granted by the Court WITHOUT PREJUDICE.

Defendant Troy Earl Smith Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Troy Earl Smith Jr.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial held.  Parties remain in trial posture.  Any further motions will be heard on day of trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 10/26/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.
Received and Filed. Defendant's Witness List
Received and Filed. Defendant's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine

Defendant Troy Earl Smith Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Troy Earl Smith Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Troy Earl Smith in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Calendar Call held.  Defendant appearing in court, Court withdraws previously stayed bench warrant.  Defense counsel requests status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court.  Josh Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Calendar call scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Troy Earl Smith in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Court is in trial on another case and is unable to proceed on this matter. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Troy Earl Smith in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Mark Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for pretrial conference. Court is in trial on another case and is unable to proceed on this matter. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with D.S.W. (dob 3/25/1988)
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Troy Earl Smith in court.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 35 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/12/22 @ 1p
